result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aristide Serrano

defendant.name: Serrano, Aristide
defendant.address: 1433 W. Memorial Drive, Apt. 3, Janesville, WI 53548

records.addlTxt: INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Defendant Aristide Serrano appeared by video.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Aristide Serrano.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Larson sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Second information filed with correct dates. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
from O.R. in support of defendant with attached pictures

9:28 AM Defendant Aristide Serrano appeared by video.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Aristide Serrano.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Joseph Fox sworn in testified by video. Court takes Judicial Notice of 18CF504. State requests continuance for second Witness to appear, Defense objects. Court finds good cause to continue. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

8:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Aristide Serrano appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald in court for Aristide Serrano. Officer Struely sworn in and testified by video. Witness identifies Defendant. Second Witness unavailable. State requests continuance, Defense requests dismissal. Court finds good cause to continue matter. Defendant requests continuance via zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:32 PM  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aristide Serrano appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Attorney C. James Fitzgerald.  Preliminary hearing requested within time limits in person.  Preliminary Hearing on July 25, 2022 at 8:30.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aristide Serrano appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Aristide Serrano. Public defender to appoint counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

04:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Aristide Serrano appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail. No Attorney appointed yet. Matter continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:06 PM Defendant Aristide Serrano in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Anna Hartz appearing by video.   David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $250.00   with standard conditions and additional conditions of No contact directly or indirectly with victim O.R. or J.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance July 6, 2022 at 1:00 pm.
